taxon_name.authority: (Hooker) de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe cardueae;genus cirsium;species remotifolium;variety remotifolium

bio:treatment.description: Phyllaries imbricate or often subequal, narrowly oblong or linear, entire or sometimes weakly expanded and scarious. Corollas cream-colored, 20–28 mm, tubes 6–12 mm, throats 8–10 mm, lobes 4.5–6.5 mm.
Fields, meadows, forest openings, open woods, brushy slopes;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety remotifolium occurs primarily west of the Cascade Range in Washington and Oregon and on coastal-facing slopes in northwestern California. Intermediates with var. odontolepis are known through much of that range.
